member.name: M:MessageBus.IExceptionNotification.NotifyException(MessageBus.MessageId,System.Object,System.Exception)
member.summary: Gets called when an exception occured within any handler. The parameter is the correlation id of the message which got procssed. is the actual message which got processed. Normally this can be something implementing , or . is the exception which didn't get caught within the handler itself.
member.remarks: The notification process main purpose is to implement logging or a custom dead letter. Do not throw the provided exception.

member.name: T:MessageBus.AwaitHandle`1
member.summary: Allows to wait until the previous defined condition are met. This class auto disposes itself within the . So you don't need to call Dispose by yourself.

member.name: M:MessageBus.IMessageBusPublishing.FireEvent``1(``0)
member.summary: Fires the provided to all handlers which are currently subscribed to the provided event type. This method will return immediately.
member.exception: Is thrown if the object is already disposed.

member.name: M:MessageBus.IMessageBusPublishing.FireCommand``1(``0)
member.summary: Fires the provided to all handlers which are currently subscribed to the provided event type.
member.exception: Is thrown if the object is already disposed.

member.name: M:MessageBus.IMessageBusPublishing.FireCommandAndWait``1(``0,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Fires the provided to one of the currently subscribed handlers for the provided event type. This method will not return until the handler has sent back a response. If no handler for the provided is available, this method will never return.
member.remarks: Normally you should not wait for a command result. If the handler is currently not available, the command might get executed even after the has been cancelled. If no cancellation token is set, the call might return in the far future. If possible, use , fire events within the handler itself and continue with the workflow after receiving these events.
member.exception: Is thrown if the provided is cancelled.
Is thrown if the object is already disposed.
Exceptions which happened within the handler will get rethrown.

member.name: M:MessageBus.IMessageBusPublishing.FireQuery``2(``0,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Fires the provided to one of the currently subscribed handlers for the provided event type. This method will not return until the handler has sent back a response. If no handler for the provided is available, this method will never return.
member.exception: Is thrown if the provided is cancelled.
Is thrown if the object is already disposed.
Exceptions which happened within the handler will get rethrown.

member.name: M:MessageBus.IMessageBusPublishing.FireRpc``2(``0,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Executes the remote procedure with the provided to one of the currently subscribed handlers. This method will not return until the handler has sent back a response. If no handler for the provided is available, this method will never return.
member.remarks: While a RPC might look identical to a query, it is semantically different. A query should not change any state while an RPC doesn't have this constraint. However, if you want to go with asynchronious communication, you should avoid RPC calls and replace them with Commands.
member.exception: Is thrown if the provided is cancelled.
Is thrown if the object is already disposed.
Exceptions which happened within the handler will get rethrown.

member.name: T:MessageBus.MessageId
member.summary:
Uniquely identifies a single request. General rule of thumb:
Commands and queries create a new MessageId by using or use when having an existing CorrelationId within a Command or Query handler.
If you create Commands because of an event, create a new CorrelationId by using and pass the MessageId of the event.

member.name: P:MessageBus.MessageId.Value
member.summary: The raw value.

member.name: P:MessageBus.MessageId.CausationId
member.summary: The correlationId which is the reason this message happened. Will be null if no causation id exists.

member.summary: The payload of the message.

member.name: M:MessageBus.Messaging.IMessageBroker.Events(MessageBus.Messaging.TopicName,MessageBus.Messaging.EventsOptions)
member.summary: Gets the channel with the provided name used for broadcasting events. If the channel didn't exist before, it will automatically get created. Event channels will not try to resend message if they weren't acknowledged. If multiple events are pending for a single event listener, each event will get forwarded to the listener separately. The handler won't get called simulatinously for multiple events. The execution order of messages is not guaranteed to be the same as the order the messages got published. The define the desired behavior of the events channel. If a channel is not created within this call, the provided value for is ignored.
member.exception: Is thrown if the provided already exists but it isn't a events channel.

member.name: M:MessageBus.Messaging.IMessageBroker.Commands(MessageBus.Messaging.TopicName)
member.summary: Gets the command channel with the provided name. If the channel didn't exist before, it will automatically get created. Command channels will resend a message if it hasn't been acknowledged or rejected. A message will only get send to one subscriber. Each subscriber will only receive one message at a time. The execution order of messages is not guaranteed to be the same as the order the messages got published.
member.exception: Is thrown if the provided already exists but it isn't a command channel.

member.name: M:MessageBus.Messaging.IMessageBroker.Publish``1(``0,System.Collections.Generic.IReadOnlyList{MessageBus.Messaging.TopicName})
member.summary: Publishes the provided to all channels specified in . If a channel does not exist, it will get skipped silently.

member.summary: No special channel options provided.

member.name: F:MessageBus.Messaging.EventsOptions.Temporary
member.summary: The channel is only used temporary and can be removed as soon as its last subscription was disposed.

member.summary: Waits for the next work item to be available. Returns true if work is available, otherwise false. Returns false if the specified has been reached. If the result is true, a item gets returned. The returned item must get executed by calling .

member.name: M:MessageBus.Messaging.ISubscribable.Subscribe``1(System.Action{MessageBus.Messaging.IMessage{``0}})
member.summary: Add a new subscription to the current channel. The passed will get called for each event which got published to the current channel. Note: depending on the used broker scheduler, the callback will get called from multiple threads and might even get called simultaniously for different events. The should match the type of the message which gets send with .
